trend_summary: Imagery sequence shows steady woodland reduction and enlargement of rectangular crop fields, particularly along the new mid-corridor highway. Small villages grow only marginally; no continuous built-up fabric forms. Overall land use shifts toward intensified agriculture with limited infrastructure expansion while the landscape remains predominantly rural and sparsely settled.
notable_changes: Construction of an eastâ€“west highway cutting through the centre of the area.
Progressive clearing and fragmentation of forests in north-central and south-western zones.
Field consolidation and expansion of cropland, especially in the north-east quadrant.
Minor outward growth of village clusters along the new transport corridor.
Emergence of a few small farm reservoirs and ponds near eastern parcels.
